I guess ancient time was simple and less confusing 😅. In my culture we used turmeric, neem,besan,curd,lentil beans, butter, rose petals and water,sandalwood  powder, shankh powder, honey,rice starch,soap nuts,multani mati,rain water for skin care and for makeup they used shankh powder as base, charcoal powder mixed with oil as eyeliner, alta for feet and hand decorating also nail, mehedi leaves for nail stains, sidhur or tip or sometimes  used sidhur mixed with oil as lipstick or there were some types of flower petals or powder available to use as lipstick and some amber smell for hair. The only thing is these were only available for elites and middle class women

I'm on my 2nd bottle of The Rice Toner from "I'm From" and there's not a single day that I don't get compliments from people ...even from strangers. My skin is plumped, dewy & just immaculately flawless ❤

That cleansing oil is really good. I bought it on sale and though I’ve tried others such as Heimush much lauded cleansing balm, I keep going back to this one. It also has a citrus scent that I really like and is even better used with their manyo cleansing foam (but I’ve found I don’t need to on nights I’m very tired) if you like a two-step cleansing process. I can’t stop touching my skin as I can’t believe how clean it feels. But it’s not irritated or dry.

manyo cleansing oil was the first skincare product i spent this much money on and i've been using it ever since!! (for over a year) even after the first usage i saw major improvement and it LITERALLY CLEANSES ALL OF YOUR IMPURITIES and makes your skin feel sooo good 😭
